column8: We must cry afar of after him, we must with deep lowliness and humility of heart, pray unto him and say: PAGEcli PAGEcli PAGEcli PAGEcli Jesus, Saviour, and master, have mercy on us, take pity and compassion over us By this means after that we have ones offered and presented our selves unto the priests, which have authority and power of God for to discern and judge, unto the scripture, between the lepry and not lepry, that is to say, between heresy and verity, between vice and virtue, and according unto the scripture, to assoil, as saint Paule did assoil a sinner of which is made mention in the seconde epistle unto the Corinthians, we shall received again into the number of the faithful, even into you flock of Jesu Christ But after that we shall assoiled of God in troth, and of men in signs, we must yet beware that we be not ingrate, churlish, nor unthankful to God, as the ix lazars were which did not return, for to yield thanks and praises to Christ, and for to gyve glory unto god for the great benefit and goodness that they had received of him.

column7: Let vs be lyke the lazar Samaritane, which fygured the christen getyls, and let vs saye that whych the spirite of God sayeth by the prophete Dauid in the.cij. psalme.
column8: Let us be like the lazar Samaritane, which figured the christian getyls, and let us say that which the spirit of God sayeth by the prophet Dauid in the cij psalm.

column7: My soule, blesse thou the Lorde God and do not forget all hys rewardes, whych maketh hole all thyne iniquities & all thy syckenesses.
column8: My soul, bless thou the Lord God and do not forget all his rewards, which makes hold all thine iniquities & all thy sicknesses.

column7: Thys let vs do, to thintent oure Lorde maye semblably saye vnto euery one of vs. Ryse vp, and go thy waye, thy true ernest and catholyke fayth hath preserued and made the hole.
column8: This let us do, to intent our Lord may semblably say unto every one of us Rise up, and go thy way, thy true earnest and catholic faith hath preserved and made the hold.

column7: Hense forth se thou synne nomore, walke nomore after the flesh, but after the spirite.
column8: Hense forth see thou sin nomore, walk nomore after the flesh, but after the spirit.

column7: Yf we thus do (my fredes) doubt we not, but we shall haue the rewarde of euer lastynge blesse, whych is endles ioye in the heauenly Hierusalem wyth the father, sonne, and holy goost.
column8: If we thus do (my fredes) doubt we not, but we shall have the reward of ever lasting bless, which is endless joy in the heavenly Hierusalem with the father, son, and holy ghost.

column7: To whome be all glorie and imperie, in infinita sesecula.
column8: To whom be all glory and impery, in infinita sesecula.

column7: Amen.: homily The Epistle on the.xv. sondaye after Trinitie.
column8: Amen.: homily The Epistle on the xv sondaye after Trinitie.

column7: The.v. and.vi. chapter to the Galathians.
column8: The v and vi chapter to the Galathians.

column7: Thargument.
column8: Thargument.

column7: An exhortacion to good workes.
column8: And exhortation to good works.

column7: B Rethren, yf we lyue in the spirite, let vs walke in the spirite.
column8: BRethren BRethren, if we live in the spirit, let us walk in the spirit.

column7: Let vs not be desyrous of vayne glorye, prouokynge one another, enuyenge one an other.
column8: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, enuyenge one and other.

column7: Brethren, yf a man also be taken in any faute ye whyche are spirituall: helpe to amende hymin the spirite of mekenes: consyderynge thy selfe, lest thou also be tempted.
column8: Brothers, if a man also be taken in any fault you which are spiritual: help to amend hymin the spirit of meekness: considering thy self, lest thou also be tempted.

column7: Beare ye one anothers burthen, and so fulfyll the lawe of Christ.
column8: Bear you one another's burden, and so fulfil the law of Christ.

column7: For yf any man seme to hymselfe that he is somwhat, whan in dede he is nothynge, the same deceyueth hys owne mynde.
column8: For if any man seem to himself that he is somewhat, when in deed he is nothing, the same deceiveth his own mind.

column7: Let euery man proue hys owne worke, and then shall he haue reioysynge, onely in hys owne selfe, and not in another.
column8: Let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing, only in his own self, and not in another.

column7: For euery man shall beare hys owne burthen.
column8: For every man shall bear his own burden.

column7: Let hym that is taught in the worde, minister vnto hym that teacheth hym, in al good thynges.
column8: Let him that is taught in the word, minister unto him that teaches him, in all good things.

column7: Be not deceyued, God is not mocked.
column8: Be not deceived, God is not mocked.

column7: For what so euer a man soweth, that shall he al so reape.
column8: For what so ever a man soweth, that shall he all so reap.

column7: For he that soweth in hys fleshe, shall of the fleshe reape corrupcion: But he that soweth in the spirite, shall of the spirite reape lyfe euerlastyng Let vs not be wery of well doynge.
column8: For he that soweth in his flesh, shall of the flesh reap corruption: But he that soweth in the spirit, shall of the spirit reap life everlasting Let us not be weary of well doing.

column7: For whan the tyme is come, we shall reape wythout werynes.
column8: For when the time is come, we shall reap without werynes.

column7: P A G Eclij While we haue therfore tyme: let vs do good vnto all men, and specially vnto them whych are of the housholde of fayth.
column8: PAGEclij PAGEclij PAGEclij PAGEclij While we have therefore time: let us do good unto all men, and specially unto them which are of the household of faith.

column7: W Elbeloued frendes in our Lorde Iesu Christ, ye shal vnderstande, that our Sauiour in the Gospell of saynt Mattheu sayeth, <NOTE> that euery tree is knowen by hys frute, for a good tree beareth good frute, but an euell tree bryngeth forth euell frute.
column8: Well-beloved Well-beloved friends in our Lord Jesu Christ, you shall understand, that our Saviour in the Gospel of saint Mattheum sayeth, that every tree is known by his fruit, for a good tree bears good fruit, but and evil tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

column7: Therfore the holy Apostle of God saynt Paul doth in thys epistle admonyshe vs christen folke, that yf we be good trees we ought to bringe forth good frutes, and yf we lyue in the spirite, as christe me ought to lyue, that we must walke also in spirite.
column8: Therefore the holy Apostle of God saint Paul does in this epistle admonish us christen folk, that if we be good trees we ought to bring forth good fruits, and if we live in the spirit, as christe me ought to live, that we must walk also in spirit.

column7: For surely it is not ynough for vs to be called christen folke, onles we do also the dedes and workes of christen folke.
column8: For surely it is not enough for us to be called christen folk, unless we do also the deeds and works of christian folk.

column7: It is not ynough for the to saye, I haue receyued the holy goost, or I haue fayth, <NOTE> thou shewest not worthy workes and frutes of the spirite.
column8: It is not enough for thee to say, I have received the holy ghost, or I have faith, thou shewest not worthy works and fruits of the spirit.

column7: Nowe one of the fyrst and principall frutes of the spirite, is loue and brotherly supportacion or bearynge of one another, whych thynge saynt Paule doth admonysh vs here of, that we shulde kepe, where he sayeth: Let vs not be desyrous of vayne glorye.
column8: Now one of the fyrst and principal fruits of the spirit, is love and brotherly supportation or bearing of one another, which thing saint Paule does admonish us here of, that we should keep, where he sayeth: Let us not be desirous of vain glory.

column7: &c. Certes it is not possible for a man or woman yt is vayne gloriouse and that loueth to be auaunced and praysed of the worlde, eyther to supporte, or to forbeare much an other man, for he wyll alwayes couet to be herde afore all other, and to be obeyed in all places, wheresoeuer he goeth or rydeth.
column8: etc. Certes it is not possible for a man or woman that is vain glorious and that loves to be advanced and praised of the world, either to support, or to forbear much and other man, for he will always covet to be herd afore all other, and to be obeyed in all places, wheresoever he goes or rideth.

column7: Certaynly my frendes vayneglorie is an appetyte or luste of all lustes the moost daugerouse and the moost subtyle and secretest that may be ymagined, in so much, that those persones, whych be estemed for moost spiritual, most holy, moost godly, be oftentymes infected therwyth.
column8: Certainly my friends vayneglorie is and appetite or lust of all lusts the most daugerouse and the most subtle and secretest that may be imagined, in so much, that those persons, which be esteemed for most spiritual, most holy, most godly, be oftentimes infected therewith.

column7: Let vs (sayeth Paule) not be couetous of vayneglorye, prouokyng one another, nor hauinge enuye one at an other.
column8: Let us (sayeth Paule) not be covetous of vainglory, provoking one another, nor having envy one at and other.

column7: But yf any one amonges you be taken in any faulte or offence through frayltie of nature & not by obstinate euelnes, you (sayeth Paule) whyche be or ought to be spirituall, teach hym & helpe to amende hym in all mekenesse, in al swetnes of spirite, consyderynge in your selues, that ye also may fal in to lyke temptacion.
column8: But if any one among you be taken in any fault or offence through frailty of nature & not by obstinate euelnes, you (sayeth Paule) which be or ought to be spiritual, teach him & help to amend him in all meekness, in all sweetness of spirit, considering in your selves, that you also may fall in to like temptation.

column7: As yf he shulde saye: Do not bragge nor vaunt your selues in the fall of another body, but rather consyder that euen the same or lyke erroure maye happen vnto you.
column8: As if he should say: Do not brag nor vaunt your selves in the fallen of another body, but rather consider that even the same or like error may happen unto you.

column7: And therfore saynt Paul sayth in another place. <NOTE> He yt thynketh hymselfe to be standynge, let hym take hede he fall not.
column8: And therefore saint Paul say in another place. He that thinketh himself to be standing, let him take heed he fallen not.

column7: Se ye beare & supporte one anothers burthen & charge, and so ye shall accomplysh the lawe of Iesu Christ. <NOTE> loueth hys neyghboure, he hath fulfylled the lawe, <NOTE> as wytnesseth the apostle in hys epistle to the Romaynes.
column8: See you bear & support one another's burden & charge, and so you shall accomplish the law of Jesu Christ. loves his neighbour, he hath fulfilled the law, as witnesseth the apostle in his epistle to the Romans.

column7: Abuse not then your selues in trustynge in your selues and thynkynge your selues to be any thynge.
column8: Abuse not then your selves in trusting in your selves and thinking your selves to be any thing.

column7: For surely ye be nothynge, ye can do nothynge, ye are worth nothyng, yf God put not his hande vnto you.
column8: For surely you be nothing, you can do nothing, you are worth nothing, if God put not his hand unto you.

column7: So then of your selues ye can worthely chalenge nothynge.
column8: So then of your selves you can worthily challenge nothing.

column7: He that alloweth and praiseth hymselfe, is not forthwith approued & allowed, but he is prayse worthy, he is allowable, whom god prayseth & alloweth. <NOTE> Wherfore let euery bodye loke on hymselfe and well consyder hymselfe, and he shal haue none occasion to bragge and glorie wyth hymselfe P A G Ecliij ouer the frailtie and weaknes of other persons.
column8: He that alloweth and praiseth himself, is not forthwith approved & allowed, but he is praise worthy, he is allowable, whom god praiseth & alloweth. Wherefore let every body look on himself and well consider himself, and he shall have none occasion to brag and glory with himself PAGEcliij PAGEcliij PAGEcliij PAGEcliij over the frailty and weakness of other persons.

column7: What so euer it be, euery man shall beare hys owne fardell, hys owne burthen. <NOTE> The sonne of man shall yelde vnto euery man accordynge to hys workes as he hymselfe testifyeth.
column8: What so ever it be, every man shall bear his own farthel, his own burden. The son of man shall yield unto every man according to his works as he himself testifieth.

column7: After saint Paule had thus greatly praysed and commended brotherly supportacion or bearyng one wyth another, he nowe exhorteth christen men to be helpynge and releuynge to all the bodely necessities of them that do teach the fayth and the gospel of Iesu Christ.
column8: After saint Paule had thus greatly praised and commended brotherly supportation or bearing one with another, he now exhorteth christen men to be helping and releuynge to all the bodily necessities of them that do teach the faith and the gospel of Jesu Christ.

column7: He sayeth: Do not erre, abuse not your selues, for god can neyther be mocked nor begyled.
column8: He sayeth: Do not err, abuse not your selves, for god can neither be mocked nor beguiled.

column7: For what thynge so euer a man soweth, the same shal he also reape and gather agayne, as who shulde saye.
column8: For what thing so ever a man soweth, the same shall he also reap and gather again, as who should say.

column7: All that whych a man doth or soweth in thys world, he shall fynde it and reape it in the other world, <NOTE> whyther it be good or euell.
column8: All that which a man does or soweth in this world, he shall find it and reap it in the other world, whither it be good or evil.

column7: Certaynly my frendes there be two maner of feldes whych men do sowe, there is the fylde of the flesh, and the fylde of the spirite.
column8: Certainly my friends there be two manner of fields which men do sow, there is the filled of the flesh, and the filled of the spirit.

column7: He that soweth in hys flesh, that is to saye, he that doth the workes of the fleshe, whych be euell workes, deuelysh workes, vngodly workes, shal of the flesh reape corruption and euerlastynge curse and damnation But he that soweth in the spirite shall of the spirite reape euerlastynge lyfe.
column8: He that soweth in his flesh, that is to say, he that does the works of the flesh, which be evil works, devilish works, ungodly works, shall of the flesh reap corruption and everlasting curse and damnation But he that soweth in the spirit shall of the spirit reap everlasting life.

column7: Wherfore in the meane tyme, whyle we haue space to sowe, let vs sowe in spirite, let vs sow good sedes, christen sedes, charitable sedes, let vs do well wythout fayntynge, wythoute beynge wery, not only to them, whych do good vnto vs, but vnto all, and principally vnto the good and faythfull christen men.
column8: Wherefore in the mean time, while we have space to sow, let us sow in spirit, let us sow good sedes, christen sedes, charitable sedes, let us do well without fainting, without being weary, not only to them, which do good unto us, but unto all, and principally unto the good and faithful christian men.

column7: And doubte we not, but we shall gather in, and reape in tyme conuenient good and full haruest in eternall lyfe to the glorie of the eternall father of heauen.
column8: And doubt we not, but we shall gather in, and reap in time convenient good and full harvest in eternal life to the glory of the eternal father of heaven.

column7: Vnto whome be thankes.
column8: Unto whom be thanks.

column7: Amen.
column8: Amen.

column7: : homily The Gospel on the.xv. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: : homily The Gospel on the xv sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.vi. Chapter of Matheu.
column8: The vi Chapter of Matheu.

column7: Thargument Christe forbyddeth vs here to seke carefully for worldly thynges.
column8: Thargument Christe forbiddeth us here to seek carefully for worldly things.

column7: I Esus sayd vnto hys disciples.
column8: IEsus IEsus said unto his disciples.

column7: No man can serue two maysters.
column8: No man can serve two masters.

column7: For eyther he shall hate the one, and loue the other, or els leane to the one, and despyce the other: ye can not serue God and Mammo.
column8: For either he shall hate the one, and love the other, or else lean to the one, and despyce the other: you can not serve God and Mammo.

column7: Therfore I saye vnto you: be not careful for your lyfe what ye shall eate or drynke, nor yet for your bodye, what raymet ye shall put on.
column8: Therefore I say unto you: be not careful for your life what you shall eat or drink, nor yet for your body, what raymet you shall put on.

column7: Is not the lyfe more worth than meate, and the body more of value than rayment?
column8: Is not the life more worth than meat, and the body more of valve than raiment?

column7: Beholde the foules of the ayer, for they sowe not, neyther do they reape, nor cary into the barnes: and youre heauenly father fedeth them.
column8: Behold the fowls of the air, for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor carry into the barns: and your heavenly father feedeth them.

column7: Are ye not much better than they?
column8: Are you not much better than they?

column7: Whyche of you (by takynge careful thought) can adde one cubyte vnto hys stature?
column8: Which of you (by taking careful thought) can add one cubyte unto his stature?

column7: And why care ye for rayment?
column8: And why care you for raiment?

column7: Consyder the lylyes of the felde, howe they growe.
column8: Consider the lylyes of the field, how they grow.

column7: They laboure not, neyther do they spynne And yet I saye vnto you, that euen Salomon in all hys royaltie was not arayed lyke one of these.
column8: They labour not, neither do they spynne And yet I say unto you, that even Salomon in all his royalty was not arrayed like one of these.

column7: Wherfore, yf God so cloth the grasse of the felde (whych though it stande to daye, is to morow cast into the fornace) shall he not muche more do the P A G Ecliiij same for you O ye of lytle fayth?
column8: Wherefore, if God so cloth the grass of the field (which though it stand to day, is to morrow cast into the furnace) shall he not much more doe the PAGEcliiij PAGEcliiij PAGEcliiij PAGEcliiij same for you O you of little faith?

column7: Therfore take no thought, sayenge: what shall we eate, or what shal we drinke: or wherwith shal we be clothed? after al these thynges do the gentyls seke.
column8: Therefore take no thought, saying: what shall we eat, or what shall we drink: or wherewith shall we be clothed? after all these things do the gentles seek.

column7: For your heuenly father knoweth, that ye haue nede of all these thynges.
column8: For your heavenly father knoweth, that you have need of all these things.

column7: But rather seke ye fyrst the kyngdome of God, and the ryghtwysnes therof, and al these thinges shalbe ministred vnto you.
column8: But rather seek you fyrst the kingdom of God, and the rightwiseness thereof, and all these things shall ministered unto you.

column7: G Ood people yf we were christen men and wome wyth hartes and wyth workes, I say yf we dyd beleue sufficiently as we boast our selues to beleue in Iesu Christ and in hys blessed and pure word, we shulde wythoute fayle not be so troubled nor dysmayd nor yet so pensyfe and so carefull whan we haue any mysfortune and necessitie.
column8: GOod GOod people if we were christian men and wome with hearts and with works, I say if we did believe sufficiently as we boast our selves to believe in Jesu Christ and in his blessed and pure word, we should without fail not be so troubled nor dismayed nor yet so pensive and so careful when we have any misfortune and necessity.

column7: Iesu Christ our sauiour doth comaunde vs that we shulde in no wyse take thought what we shuld eate, or what we shuld drynke, or wherwyth we shulde be clothed.
column8: Jesu Christ our saviour does command us that we should in no wise take thought what we should eat, or what we should drink, or wherewith we should be clothed.

column7: And that they be the carnall men, the paynyms and infideles whych take thought for these thynges: and not the true & faythful christen men.
column8: And that they be the carnal men, the painims and infideles which take thought for these things: and not the true & faithful christian men.

column7: He sayeth and assureth vs in the Gospell of thys daye, that God hys father and ours, shall nourysh vs and arraye vs: And for all thys, as yf he were a lyer & an abuser, we do not beleue in hym nor in hys wordes.
column8: He sayeth and assureth us in the Gospel of this day, that God his father and ours, shall nourish us and array us: And for all this, as if he were a liar & and abuser, we do not believe in him nor in his words.

column7: Certes the infidelitie of the worlde is greate.
column8: Certes the infidelity of the world is great.

column7: The worlde I saye is blynde, whych thynketh to beleue so well and so fermely, and yet beleueth neuer a deale.
column8: The world I say is blind, which thinketh to believe so well and so firmly, and yet believeth never a deal.

column7: We do great iniury vnto Iesu Christ in mystrustynge hym.
column8: We do great injury unto Jesu Christ in mistrusting him.

column7: But it is to be noted for the vnderstandynge of thys text yt our Lord forbyddeth christen me to take thought: but he doth not forbydde them to laboure: but commaudeth that euery body shulde laboure accordyng to the grace & might that god hath giue him.
column8: But it is to be noted for the understanding of this text that our Lord forbiddeth christen me to take thought: but he does not forbid them to labour: but commaudeth that every body should labour according to the grace & might that god hath give him.

column7: In the sweate of thy vysage thou shalt eat thy breade (sayeth he in the.iij. chapter of Genesis) And for all the rest let hym cast all hys hope in god.
column8: In the sweat of thy visage thou shalt eat thy bread (sayeth he in the iij chapter of Genesis) And for all the rest let him cast all his hope in god.

column7: And as S. Peter sheweth vs in the.v. chapter of hys fyrst Epistle, and the Prophete in the.liiij. psalme.
column8: And as S. Peter shows us in the v chapter of his fyrst Epistle, and the Prophet in the liiij psalm.

column7: Cast thy care vpon the Lorde God, and he shall nourysh the.
column8: Cast thy care upon the Lord God, and he shall nourish thee.

column7: And saynt Paule sayeth in the.iiij. chapter vnto the Philippians.
column8: And saint Paule sayeth in the iiij chapter unto the Philippians.

column7: Be not carefull for any thynge but in all prayer and petition wyth thankesgyuynge let your prayers be knowen vnto God.
column8: Be not careful for any thing but in all prayer and petition with thankesgyuynge let your prayers be known unto God.

column7: And saynt Peter in ye v. chapter of ye aforesayd epistle sayeth: Cast al your thought in him which hath care of you.
column8: And saint Peter in the v. chapter of the aforesaid epistle sayeth: Cast all your thought in him which hath care of you.

column7: And for this cause saynt Hierome expounynge thys place sayeth in thys wyse. <NOTE> We be here commaunded by Christe, not to be careful what we shulde eate, for in the swet of our face, we prepare vnto vs breade.
column8: And for this cause saint Hierome exponing this place sayeth in this wise. We be here commanded by Christe, not to be careful what we should eat, for in the sweated of our face, we prepare unto us bread.

column7: Laboure ought therfore to be exercised, <NOTE> but care taken away.
column8: Labour ought therefore to be exercised, but care taken away.

column7: Here wyth agreeth Chrysostome sayenge: Not with spirituall cares, but wyth bodely labours, we muste seke our fode, whyche fode abundeth to suche as laboure for it by gods gyfte for a rewarde of theyr diligence, and on the other syde it is wythdrawe from such as despyce laboure, <NOTE> gods doynge for a punyshment.
column8: Here with agreeth Chrysostome saying: Not with spiritual cares, but with bodily labours, we must seek our food, which food aboundeth to such as labour for it by gods gift for a reward of their diligence, and on the other side it is withdraw from such as despyce labour, gods doing for a punishment.

column7: But thys that Christ speaketh here (sayeth saynt Hierome) is to be vnderstande, of the bodely meate and rayment.
column8: But this that Christ speaks here (sayeth saint Hierome) is to be understand, of the bodily meat and raiment.

column7: For of the goostly fode & rayment we ought alwayes to be carefull.
column8: For of the ghostly food & raiment we ought always to be careful.

column7: Our Lorde for to rebuke vs the more of our lytle fayth byddeth vs beholde the byrdes, and the lylies of the feldes, P A G Eclv vnto who God prouideth.
column8: Our Lord for to rebuke us the more of our little faith biddeth us behold the birds, and the lilies of the fields, PAGEclv PAGEclv PAGEclv PAGEclv unto who God provideth.

column7: And be we no more worth then the byrdes: or then the floures of lylies of ye feldes?
column8: And be we no more worth then the birds: or then the flowers of lilies of the fields?

column7: He doth then defende vs to take thought for earthly thynges, to thende that our spirite maye the better be lyfte vp vnto the heauenly thynges: for a man to take thought and care for the one and the other, it is vnpossible.
column8: He does then defend us to take thought for earthly things, to th'end that our spirit may the better be lift up unto the heavenly things: for a man to take thought and care for the one and the other, it is unpossible.

column7: Who so euer hath tasted of the true goodnesse of God, he doth vntaste and myslyke the flatterynge and vayne goodnes of the earth.
column8: Who so ever hath tasted of the true goodness of God, he does untaste and mislike the flattering and vain goodness of the earth.

column7: For none can serue two maysters at ones.
column8: For none can serve two masters at ones.

column7: He can not serue both God and also Mammon.
column8: He can not serve both God and also Mammon.

column7: Mammon in the Syriake spech (sayeth S. Hierom) is called ryches. <NOTE> Let the couetouse person tha heare thys, that he can not both serue Christe and ryches, and yet he sayeth not, he that hath ryches but he that serueth ryches.
column8: Mammon in the Syriake speech (sayeth S. Hierom) is called riches. Let the covetous person tha hear this, that he can not both serve Christe and riches, and yet he sayeth not, he that hath riches but he that serveth riches.

column7: For he that is the seruaunt of ryches, kepeth ryches as a seruaunt or bondman, but he that hath shaken of, the yoke of bondage or seruitude, <NOTE> he gyueth them as a lorde.
column8: For he that is the servant of riches, keepeth riches as a servant or bondman, but he that hath shaken of, the yoke of bondage or servitude, he gyveth them as a lord.

column7: And saynt Austine sayth: He that serueth Mammon, that is to say, ryches, serueth hym which by the meryte of hys peruersitie is called of our lord the prince of thys worlde that is to saye the deuell.
column8: And saint Austine say: He that serveth Mammon, that is to say, riches, serveth him which by the merit of his perversity is called of our lord the prince of this world that is to say the devil.

column7: Wherfore here be reproued all couetous folkes, whych do set and fixe so much theyr hartes vnto the worlde: and so lytle vnto god.
column8: Wherefore here be reproved all covetous folks, which do set and fix so much their hearts unto the world: and so little unto god.

column7: Let vs then beleue at the lest Iesu Christ whych doth not lye: and care we not for to gather goodes, but let vs rather care for the kyngdome of God only and for hys iustice: and to obtayne hys grace and for the rest ther shalbe gyuen vs asmuche as we shall lacke for to passe soberly thys lyfe wyth pacience. <NOTE> Seke ye than fyrst (sayeth Christ) the kyngdome of god and the iustice therof The kyngdome of God, <NOTE> as holy Chrysostome expouneth, is the retribucion or rewarde of good workes, and the iustice therof, is the waye of godlynes, wherby sayeth he, we go to the kyngdome of God.
column8: Let us then believe at the lest Jesu Christ which does not lie: and care we not for to gather goods, but let us rather care for the kingdom of God only and for his justice: and to obtain his grace and for the rest there shall given us asmuch as we shall lack for to pass soberly this life with patience. Seek you than fyrst (sayeth Christ) the kingdom of god and the justice thereof The kingdom of God, as holy Chrysostome exponeth, is the retribution or reward of good works, and the justice thereof, is the way of godliness, whereby sayeth he, we go to the kingdom of God.

column7: Yf tha thou wylt consyder, how great the glorye of the saintes shalbe, it must nedes folow, that eyther for feare of paynes thou must go fro euell, or for desyre of glorie, thou must hasten the to do good.
column8: If than thou wilt consider, how great the glory of the saints shall, it must needs follow, that either for fear of pains thou must go from evil, or for desire of glory, thou must hasten thee to do good.

column7: And yf (sayeth thys holy doctour) thou wylte consyder, what is the iustice of God, I meane, what God hateth and what he loueth, the selfe iustice shall shewe vnto the her wayes which foloweth such as loue her.
column8: And if (sayeth this holy doctor) thou wilt consider, what is the justice of God, I mean, what God hates and what he loves, the self justice shall show unto thee her ways which followeth such as love her.

column7: For we shal not be called to a rekenynge whether we be ryche or poore, but whether we haue done well or euel, which thynge (sayeth he) is in our fre wyll.
column8: For we shall not be called to a reckoning whither we be rich or poor, but whither we have done well or evil, which thing (sayeth he) is in our from will.

column7: Wherfore good people se ye do not care for your bodely sustenauce, for our Lorde doth promyse you, that it shalbe gyue vnto you, you nede not to doubt of it, yf ye cast from you thys fleshly & worldly thought full of mystrust of the prouision of God.
column8: Wherefore good people see you do not care for your bodily sustenance, for our Lord does promise you, that it shall gyve unto you, you need not to doubt of it, if you cast from you this fleshly & worldly thought full of mistrust of the provision of God.

column7: Do ye rather the contrary, haue no trust in your selues, but al in God: and you shalbe truly faythfull and the chyldren of almyghty God: and you shall lacke nothynge in thys presente tyme nor in the other to come by oure Lorde Iesu Christe vnto whome be glorie and thankes worlde wythout ende.
column8: Do you rather the contrary, have no trust in your selves, but all in God: and you shall truly faithful and the children of almighty God: and you shall lack nothing in this present time nor in the other to come by our Lord Jesu Christe unto whom be glory and thanks world without end.

column7: Amen.
column8: Amen.

column7: : homily The Epistle on the.xvi. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: : homily The Epistle on the xvi sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.iij. chapter to the Ephesians.
column8: The iij chapter to the Ephesians.

column7: Thargument Of the power, heygth, bredth, and depth of Christ, that is to say, that he is euery where, and potent in all thynges.
column8: Thargument Of the power, height, breadth, and depth of Christ, that is to say, that he is every where, and potent in all things.

column7: P A G Eclvi S Aynt Paule wrote vnto the Ephesians sayeng: I desyre, that ye faynt not because of my tribulacions that I suffre for your sakes: whyche is youre prayse.
column8: PAGEclvi PAGEclvi PAGEclvi PAGEclvi SAynt SAynt Paule wrote unto the Ephesians saying: I desire, that you faint not because of my tribulations that I suffer for your sakes: which is your praise.

column7: For thys cause I bowe my knees to the father of our Lorde Iesus Christ, whych is father ouer all that is called father in heauen and in earth, that he wolde graunt you accordinge to the ryches of hys glory, that ye may be stregthed with might by hys spirite in the ynner man, that Christe maye dwell in your hartes by fayth, that ye beyng roted and grouded in loue, myght be able to coprehede wyth all sayntes, what is that bredth and length, depth and heyght: and to knowe the excellent loue of the knowlege of Christ, that ye myght be fulfylled wyth all fulnes, which commeth of God.
column8: For this cause I bow my knees to the father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is father over all that is called father in heaven and in earth, that he would grant you according to the riches of his glory, that you may be stregthed with might by his spirit in the ynner man, that Christe may dwell in your hearts by faith, that you being roted and grouded in love, might be able to coprehede with all saints, what is that breadth and length, depth and height: and to know the excellent love of the knowledge of Christ, that you might be fulfilled with all fullness, which comes of God.

column7: Vnto hym that is able to do excedynge aboundauntly aboue all that we aske or thynke accordynge to the power that worketh in vs, be prayse in the congregacion by Iesus Christ, thorowout all generacions from tyme to tyme.
column8: Unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think according to the power that works in us, be praise in the congregation by Jesus Christ, throughout all generations from time to time.

column7: Amen.
column8: Amen.

column7: T He charge my frendes of a byshop or of a curate, is to teache continually, and to praye for the people, whych is commytted vnto hym, to thintent that it wolde please God to redresse, coforte, and assure them agaynst the temptacions of this world, as saynt Paule doth teach vs, by all hys epistles & in the epistle of thys daye he sayeth: I praye you my brethre, that you do not discomforte your selues for my tribulacions, whych I suffre for you.
column8: THe THe charge my friends of a bishop or of a curate, is to teach continually, and to pray for the people, which is committed unto him, to intent that it would please God to redress, coforte, and assure them against the temptations of this world, as saint Paule does teach us, by all his epistles & in the epistle of this day he sayeth: I pray you my brethren, that you do not discomfort your selves for my tribulations, which I suffer for you.

column7: That is to say, yf you se that I do suffre much harme, iniuries, and persecutions forbycause that I do preach vnto you the gospell, do not discourage your selues, but perseuer in ye fayth of the same.
column8: That is to say, if you see that I do suffer much harm, injuries, and persecutions forbycause that I do preach unto you the gospel, do not discourage your selves, but persever in you faith of the same.

column7: Yf the mayster hath ben euell entreated, by good ryght the seruaut must be in lyke maner.
column8: If the master hath been evil entreated, by good right the seruaut must be in like manner.

column7: Our Lorde Iesu Christe sayeth in the.x. chapter of S. Mathew.
column8: Our Lord Jesu Christe sayeth in the x chapter of S. Mathew.

column7: It suffiseth vnto the disciple for to be lyke vnto hys Mayster.
column8: It sufficeth unto the disciple for to be like unto his Master.

column7: For thys cause to thende that you shuld not discourage your selues I pray and requyre humbly the father of our Lorde Iesu Christ, the great father of housholde of the heauen and of the earth, whych is the sprynge & fountayne of all goodnes.
column8: For this cause to th'end that you should not discourage your selves I pray and require humbly the father of our Lord Jesu Christ, the great father of household of the heaven and of the earth, which is the spring & fountain of all goodness.

column7: For I knowe well, that wythout hym, you nor I can do nothynge.
column8: For I know well, that without him, you nor I can do nothing.

column7: I praye hym, that by the rychesses of hys glorie and grace, it woll please hym, to gyue vnto you by hys spirite, stregth not bodely but spiritually and inwardly, for to endure and to suffer.
column8: I pray him, that by the richesses of his glory and grace, it will please him, to gyve unto you by his spirit, strength not bodily but spiritually and inwardly, for to endure and to suffer.

column7: And that it wol please Iesu Christ, the glorie of the father, the glorie of ye angels and of men, to abyde in you by feruent faith in your hartes, founded and rooted in charitie to thyntente that you maye knowe and vnderstande the incomprehensible graces whych by him be gyuen vnto vs the largenesse and length of the same, for the earth is full of the mercy of the Loroe God (sayeth ye prophete Dauid) and the hyghnesse and depthnesse: <NOTE> for they do perse the heauens and the hylles.
column8: And that it will please Jesu Christ, the glory of the father, the glory of you angels and of men, to abide in you by fervent faith in your hearts, founded and rooted in charity to thyntente that you may know and understand the incomprehensible graces which by him be given unto us the largeness and length of the same, for the earth is full of the mercy of the Loroe God (sayeth the prophet Dauid) and the highness and depthnesse: for they do pierce the heavens and the hills.

column7: He whych is descended is he which hath ascended aboue al the heauens sayeth saint Paul. <NOTE> To thintent also that ye shall know the great charitie of Iesu Christ toward vs (the whych knowlege is more to be estemed than all the science of the worlde) and that you shulde be replenyshed in all aboundaunce wyth the graces of P A G Eclvij God.
column8: He which is descended is he which hath ascended above all the heavens sayeth saint Paul. To intent also that you shall know the great charity of Jesu Christ towards us (the which knowledge is more to be esteemed than all the science of the world) and that you should be replenished in all abundance with the graces of PAGEclvij PAGEclvij PAGEclvij PAGEclvij God.

column7: In thys epistle saynt Paule declareth in short conclusions the perfection of the christen lyfe, vnto the whych we ought to breath and to sygh.
column8: In this epistle saint Paule declareth in short conclusions the perfection of the christian life, unto the which we ought to breath and to sygh.

column7: He doth not praye that god shulde gyue them much temporall goodes for to lyue at theyr ease, but he desyreth and prayeth, that they maye haue strength for to endure and to beare with him the crosse of Iesu Christ For all the lyfe of a christen ma is to endure.
column8: He does not pray that god should gyve them much temporal goods for to live at their ease, but he desireth and prayeth, that they may have strength for to endure and to bear with him the cross of Jesu Christ For all the life of a christian ma is to endure.

column7: In the conclusion of the epistle, wyth profounde harte and wyth great spirite he yeldeth graces & louynge thankes vnto God, sayenge: Vnto him whych is able for to gyue vs more than we can demaunde or thynke, accordynge vnto the myght the whych puissantly & strongly worketh and laboureth in vs, vnto hym be yelden all glorie by all the church, by the meanes of hys sonne Iesu Christ.
column8: In the conclusion of the epistle, with profound heart and with great spirit he yieldeth graces & loving thanks unto God, saying: Unto him which is able for to gyve us more than we can demand or think, according unto thee might the which puissantly & strongly works and laboureth in us, unto him be yelden all glory by all the church, by the means of his son Jesu Christ.

column7: For euen as by him al grace is gyue vs from the father, so it must nedes be that by hym, whych is the begynnynge and the ende, all glorie be vnto hym rendered.
column8: For even as by him all grace is gyve us from the father, so it must needs be that by him, which is the beginning and the end, all glory be unto him rendered.

column7: Then my brethren, let vs not discourage our selues of the worde of God, of the doctrine of the gospell, for any tribulation or worldly vexacion that may happe vnto any of them by which it shal haue pleased God yt they shuld bear it: yf it be hys pleasure to make them to beare hys crosse: & vnto them whych shall beare it, but so much the more let vs be founded stedfast and ferme, & rooted in fayth, hope, and charitie, and we shall knowe the incoprehensible graces of God.
column8: Then my brothers, let us not discourage our selves of the word of God, of the doctrine of the gospel, for any tribulation or worldly vexation that may happen unto any of them by which it shall have pleased God that they should bear it: if it be his pleasure to make them to bear his cross: & unto them which shall bear it, but so much the more let us be founded steadfast and ferme, & rooted in faith, hope, and charity, and we shall know the incoprehensible graces of God.

column7: And he that surmounteth all myght, shall delyuer vs from al euell, and shall leade vs vnto hys glorye, vnto hys heauely kyngdome, where in eternall ioye we shall yelde perpetuall graces and prayses vnto the father of heuen by our Lorde Iesu Christ.
column8: And he that surmounteth all might, shall deliver us from all evil, and shall lead us unto his glory, unto his heavily kingdom, where in eternal joy we shall yield perpetual graces and praises unto the father of heaven by our Lord Jesu Christ.

column7: To whome.
column8: To whom.

column7: &c.: homily The Gospel on the.xvi. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: etc.: homily The Gospel on the xvi sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.vij. Chapter of Luke.
column8: The vij Chapter of Luke.

column7: Thargument.
column8: Thargument.

column7: Christ rayseth a deade man to lyfe agayne.
column8: Christ raises a dead man to life again.

column7: I Esus wente into a cytie whyche is called Naim, and many of hys disciples went wyth hym, and much people.
column8: IEsus IEsus went into a city which is called Naim, and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.

column7: Whan he came nye to the gate of the cytie: beholde, there was a deade man caryed out, whych was the only sonne of hys mother, and she was a wedowe, and much people of the cytie was wyth her.
column8: When he came nigh to the gate of the city: behold, there was a dead man carried out, which was the only son of his mother, and she was a widow, and much people of the city was with her.

column7: And whan the Lorde sawe her, he had copassion on her, and said vnto her: wepe not.
column8: And when the Lord saw her, he had copassion on her, and said unto her: weep not.

column7: And he came nye, and touched the coffyn: and they that bare hym stode styll.
column8: And he came nigh, and touched the coffin: and they that bore him stood still.

column7: And be said: Yonge man, I say vnto the, aryse.
column8: And be said: Young man, I say unto thee, arise.

column7: And he that was deade, sat vp, and began to speake.
column8: And he that was dead, sat up, and began to speak.

column7: And he delyuered hym to hys mother.
column8: And he delivered him to his mother.

column7: And there came a feare on them all.
column8: And there came a fear on them all.

column7: And they gaue the glorie vnto God, sayenge: A greate prophete is rysen vp amonge vs, and god hath vysited his people.
column8: And they gave the glory unto God, saying: A great prophet is risen up among us, and god hath visited his people.

column7: T He thynge (good people) whych is moost agreable vnto god, and that whyche he demaundeth & requyreth of vs principally, is to beleue hys word, as saynt Paule saythin the.xi. chapter of hys epistle to the Hebrues.
column8: THe THe thing (good people) which is most agreeable unto god, and that which he demandeth & requireth of us principally, is to believe his word, as saint Paule saythin the xi chapter of his epistle to the Hebrews.

column7: It is impossible to please God with out fayth.
column8: It is impossible to please God with out faith.

column7: For thys cause all the myracles whyche were at any tyme done, aswel by Iesu Christ in erth as by hym in hys members, it hath not ben for to attribute the honoure vnto hys members, or that hys members hath done myracles, but for to approue ye P A G Eclviij worde of God, and for to manyfest hys glorie and myght, to thintent that he shulde be honoured and reuerenced of euery body, and in euery place, as the prophete sayeth: Lorde god all the earth doth worship the.
column8: For this cause all the miracles which were at any time done, aswell by Jesu Christ in earth as by him in his members, it hath not been for to attribute the honour unto his members, or that his members hath done miracles, but for to approve you PAGEclviij PAGEclviij PAGEclviij PAGEclviij word of God, and for to manifest his glory and might, to intent that he should be honoured and reverenced of every body, and in every place, as the prophet sayeth: Lord god all the earth does worship thee.

column7: For thys cause oure Lorde hath raysed vp from death to lyfe the wedowes sonne, of the whych is made mention in the gospel of thys day.
column8: For this cause our Lord hath raised up from death to life the wedowes son, of the which is made mention in the gospel of this day.

column7: He hath here raised one from bodely death: for to make vs to beleue, that he hath the power also for to rayse vs agayne from spirituall death.
column8: He hath here raised one from bodily death: for to make us to believe, that he hath the power also for to raise us again from spiritual death.

column7: And also he shall rayse vs vp agayne bodely at the day of dome: As he said vnto Martha: I am the resurrection and lyfe, who so beleueth in me, he shall not dye eternally. <NOTE> All they therfore whych do not lyue accordynge vnto the spirite, whych folowe the olde lyfe of Adam, whyche accomplish the desyres, concupiscences, and workes of the flesh (of the whych was spoken in ye epistle of the last sondaye) they be deade spiritually.
column8: And also he shall raise us up again bodily at the day of dome: As he said unto Martha: I am the resurrection and life, who so believeth in me, he shall not die eternally. All they therefore which do not live according unto the spirit, which follow the old life of Adam, which accomplish the desires, concupiscences, and works of the flesh (of the which was spoken in you epistle of the last sondaye) they be dead spiritually.

column7: For who that hath not the holy goost, he hath no lyfe, he doth not belonge vnto Iesu Christ whych is the lyfe.
column8: For who that hath not the holy ghost, he hath no life, he does not belong unto Jesu Christ which is the life.

column7: Yf any hath not the spirite of Christ, he is not Christes.
column8: If any hath not the spirit of Christ, he is not Christes.

column7: Ro. viij. He is borne and conducted of euell spirites to the pytte of hell: Yf Iesu Christ do not come quyckely for to touche hym wyth hys hande, the whyche sygnifyeth hys great puissaunce and myght conioyned wyth hys worde.
column8: Ro. viij. He is born and conducted of evil spirits to the pit of hell: If Jesu Christ do not come quyckely for to touch him with his hand, the which signifieth his great puissance and might conjoined with his word.

column7: Yf he do not speake and touch lyuely the harte, it is impossible, that the sayd creatures shulde haue power to ryse agayne, or that they shulde euer chaunge from the death of the soule vnto newnes of lyfe and state of grace.
column8: If he do not speak and touch lively the heart, it is impossible, that the said creatures should have power to rise again, or that they should ever change from the death of the soul unto newness of life and state of grace.

column7: For surely so longe as we be in deadly synne and vnder the thraldome and subiection of the fende, so longe we be as deade persons. <NOTE> And therfore sayeth saynt Ambrose.
column8: For surely so long as we be in deadly sin and under the thraldom and subjection of the fend, so long we be as dead persons. And therefore sayeth saint Ambrose.

column7: We lye deade in secrete, whan eyther the fyre of vnreasonable lust brenneth vs, or the colde humoure drowneth and as it were wyth a certayne slouthfulnesse of the bodye the sharpenesse of the mynde is accombred and ouerwhelmed, in which case we can not ryse out of our drousye slomber but by Christe.
column8: We lie dead in secret, when either the fire of unreasonable lust brenneth us, or the cold humour drowneth and as it were with a certain slothfulness of the body the sharpness of the mind is accombred and overwhelmed, in which case we can not rise out of our drousye slumber but by Christe.

column7: And yf sayeth thys holy doctour saynt Ambrose, <NOTE> it be an heuye & greuouse synne whych thou thy selfe arte not able to wash awaye wyth the teares of thy penaunce and repentaunce, let thy mother the holy church wepe for the.
column8: And if sayeth this holy doctor saint Ambrose, it be and heavy & grievous sin which thou thy self art not able to wash away with the tears of thy penance and repentance, let thy mother the holy church weep for thee.

column7: Let the people also be assistente vnto her.
column8: Let the people also be assistente unto her.

column7: And fortwyth thou shalt ryse agayne oute of the coffyn or beere and shalte begynne to speake wyth an other lyfe, and all that heare it shall feare & shalbe corrected by thexemple of one. They shal also prayse God, <NOTE> whych hath gyue vs so great remedies to eschue death.
column8: And fortwyth thou shalt rise again out of the coffin or beer and shalt begin to speak with and other life, and all that hear it shall fear & shall corrected by thexemple of one. They shall also praise God, which hath gyve us so great remedies to eschew death.

column7: And here sayeth Bede is the errour of the heretiques called Nouatians confounded, whych whyle they go about to destroye the clensyng of penitent persons, do denye yt our mother ye church wepynge for ye spiritual death of her chyldren ought to be comforted by hope of restoryng agayne to lyfe Whyche damnable opinion the wycked Anabaptistes at thys daye haue renewed in dyuers places of christendome, whych denye, that they that fall into deadly synne after baptisme can by due penaunce or any other meanes come agayne to the state of grace whome we praye God to brynge out of theyr foule heresye.
column8: And here sayeth Bede is the error of the heretics called Nouatians confounded, which while they go about to destroy the cleansing of penitent persons, do deny that our mother you church weeping for you spiritual death of her children ought to be comforted by hope of restoring again to life Which damnable opinion the wicked Anabaptists at this day have renewed in dyuers places of christendome, which deny, that they that fallen into deadly sin after baptism can by due penance or any other means come again to the state of grace whom we pray God to bring out of their foul heresy.

column7: Let vs than good people instauntly & humbly praye to almyghty God the father of heuen that it wolde please hym so ofte as we fall into synne to P A G Eclix touch and speake to vs so vertuous and pythy wordes that maye quicken vs, and rayse vs from death to lyfe, in yeldynge and restorynge vs lyuyng truly in spirite vnto our mother, whych is the churche of faythfull men, and that we may speake continually the worde of prayse and of grace vnto God: in suche wyse that by occasion of vs, our neyghbours maye be edifyed and exhorted for to prayse & glorifye god wyth vs, knowynge that God hath vysited his people by Iesu Christe.
column8: Let us than good people instantly & humbly pray to almighty God the father of heaven that it would please him so oft as we fallen into sin to PAGEclix PAGEclix PAGEclix PAGEclix touch and speak to us so virtuous and pythy words that may quicken us, and raise us from death to life, in yielding and restoring us living truly in spirit unto our mother, which is the church of faithful men, and that we may speak continually the word of praise and of grace unto God: in such wise that by occasion of us, our neighbours may be edified and exhorted for to praise & glorify god with us, knowing that God hath visited his people by Jesu Christe.

column7: Vnto whome apperteyneth glorie and honoure eternally.
column8: Unto whom appertaineth glory and honour eternally.

column7: Amen.
column8: Amen.

column7: : homily The Epistle on the.xvij. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: : homily The Epistle on the xvij sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.iiij. chapter to the Ephesians.
column8: The iiij chapter to the Ephesians.

column7: Thargument.
column8: Thargument.

column7: Of the vnitie of fayth that there be no dissension amonges christen people.
column8: Of the unity of faith that there be no dissension among christian people.

column7: B Rethren, I whych am a presoner of the lordes exhorte you, that ye walke worthy of the vocacion wherwyth ye are called, wyth all lowlynes and mekenesse, wyth humblenesse of mynde, forbearinge one another thorow loue, and be diligent to kepe the vnitie of the spirite thorowe the bonde of peace, beynge one bodye, and one spirite, euen as ye are called in one hope of youre callynge.
column8: BRethren BRethren, I which am a prisoner of the lords exhort you, that you walk worthy of the vocation wherewith you are called, with all lowliness and meekness, with humbleness of mind, forbearing one another thorough love, and be diligent to keep the unity of the spirit thorough the bond of peace, being one body, and one spirit, even as you are called in one hope of your calling.

column7: Let there be but one Lorde, one fayth, one baptisme: one God and father of all, whych is aboue all, and thorow all, and in you all.
column8: Let there be but one Lord, one faith, one baptism: one God and father of all, which is above all, and thorough all, and in you all.

column7: MY brethren and systers in Iesu Christe, let vs consyder the benignitie louynge kyndnes and swetnesse of the holy goost, the whych doth not commaude vs wyth rygoure and sharpnesse (as men do often) but doth desyre vs louyngly by his great messanger the apostle saynt Paule, that we shuld walke worthely in the vocacion or callynge vnto which we be callyd.
column8: MY brothers and sisters in Jesu Christe, let us consider the benignity loving kindness and sweetness of the holy ghost, the which does not commaude us with rygoure and sharpness (as men do often) but does desire us lovingly by his great messenger the apostle saint Paule, that we should walk worthily in the vocation or calling unto which we be called.

column7: Of thys vocacion is spoken in the fyrste chapter of the fyrst epistle vnto ye Corinthias, where he sayeth: God is true and faythfull, by whome you are called into the company of hys sonne our Lorde Iesu Christ.
column8: Of this vocation is spoken in the fyrste chapter of the fyrst epistle unto you Corinthias, where he sayeth: God is true and faithful, by whom you are called into the company of his son our Lord Jesu Christ.

column7: Thys companyenge with Iesu Christ, is the christen and catholyke churche, the whyche is called a bodye, wherof he is the heade, and we be his members: in case we be conducted and leade by the holy goost.
column8: This companyenge with Jesu Christ, is the christian and catholic church, the which is called a body, whereof he is the head, and we be his members: in case we be conducted and lead by the holy ghost.

column7: For he is the sturrer, the lyfe and the conductour of all the catholyke churche, for to make it to walke worthely wyth the heade in all humilitie, mekenesse and swetnesse.
column8: For he is the stirrer, the life and the conductor of all the catholic church, for to make it to walk worthily with the head in all humility, meekness and sweetness.

column7: He doth teache vs also by true loue and charitie, in all pacience to supporte & beare ye faultes and infirmities of our neyghbours.
column8: He does teach us also by true love and charity, in all patience to support & bear you faults and infirmities of our neighbours.

column7: And saynt Paule induceth vs to do thys in the.vi. chapter of the epistle vnto the Galathians.
column8: And saint Paule induceth us to do this in the vi chapter of the epistle unto the Galathians.

column7: Beare the burthens one of another and so ye shall accomplysh the lawe of Christ.
column8: Bear the burdens one of another and so you shall accomplish the law of Christ.

column7: The whych doth admonysh vs aboue al thynges that we shulde endeuoure our selues to kepe the vnitie of the spirite of fayth in a bonde of peace and cocorde: that is to wyte in sauourynge in fayth one selfe thynge.
column8: The which does admonish us above all things that we should endeavour our selves to keep the unity of the spirit of faith in a bond of peace and cocorde: that is to wit in savouring in faith one self thing.

column7: And what is yt that we shulde all sauour?
column8: And what is that that we should all savour?

column7: That we be one body, one spirite, and all called into one hope of saluation by Iesu Christ.
column8: That we be one body, one spirit, and all called into one hope of salvation by Jesu Christ.

column7: That ther is one Lord, one fayth, one baptisme, P A G Eclx one God and father of all, whych is aboue al, and ouer all thynges, and in vs al, whych is he that is blessed in the worlde of worldes.
column8: That there is one Lord, one faith, one baptism, PAGEclx PAGEclx PAGEclx PAGEclx one God and father of all, which is above all, and over all things, and in us all, which is he that is blessed in the world of world's.

column7: Thys is ye fayth in the whych we ought to be vnied and knytte with the holy goost, and to haue stedfast peace & concorde The whych thynges yf we haue, we shalbe conducted by thys holy goost in all graces and vertues for to blesse, laude, and glorifye thys ryght hygh and souerayne father by our Lorde Iesu Christ vnto glorie of al the Trinitie wythout ende.
column8: This is the faith in the which we ought to be unied and knit with the holy ghost, and to have steadfast peace & concord The which things if we have, we shall conducted by this holy ghost in all graces and virtues for to bless, laud, and glorify this right high and sovereign father by our Lord Jesu Christ unto glory of all the Trinitie without end.

column7: Amen.
column8: Amen.

column7: : homily The gospell on the.xvij. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: : homily The gospel on the xvij sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The xiiij. chapter of Luke.
column8: The xiiij. chapter of Luke.

column7: Thargument.
column8: Thargument.

column7: Christ healeth on the sabboth daye and commended humilitie vnto vs.
column8: Christ heals on the sabbath day and commended humility unto us

column7: W Han Iesus went into the house of one of the chefe pharisees to eate breade on a Sabboth daye: and they watched hym.
column8: When When Jesus went into the house of one of the chief pharisees to eat bread on a Sabbath day: and they watched him.

column7: And behold ther was a certayne man before hym whych had the dropsy And Iesus answered and spake vnto the lawyers and pharisees, sayenge: Is it lawfull to heale vpon the sabboth daye?
column8: And behold there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy And Jesus answered and spoke unto the lawyers and pharisees, saying: Is it lawful to heal upon the sabbath day?

column7: And they helde theyr peace.
column8: And they held their peace.

column7: And he toke hym and healed hym, and let hym go: and answered them, sayenge: whych of you shall haue an asse or an oxe fallen into a pytte and wyll not strayght waye pull hym out on the sabboth daye?
column8: And he took him and healed him, and let him go: and answered them, saying: which of you shall have and ass or and ox fallen into a pit and will not straight way pull him out on the sabbath day?

column7: And they coulde not answere hym agayne to these thynges.
column8: And they could not answer him again to these things.

column7: He put forth also a similitude to the gestes, whan he marked how they preased to the hyghest roumes, and sayd vnto them: Whan thou art bydden of any man to a weddinge, syt not downe in the hyest roume, lest a more honorable man tha thou be bydden of hym, and he (that bad hym and the) come, and saye to the: gyue thys man roume, and thou than begynne wyth shame to take the lowest rowme.
column8: He put forth also a similitude to the gests, when he marked how they pressed to the highest rooms, and said unto them: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding, fit not down in the highest room, lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him, and he (that bade him and thee) come, and say to thee: gyve this man room, and thou than begin with shame to take the lowest room.

column7: But rather whan thou art bydden, go and syt in the lowest rowme: that whan he that bad the, commeth, he may saye vnto the: frende syt vp hyer.
column8: But rather when thou art bidden, go and fit in the lowest room: that when he that bade thee, comes, he may say unto thee: friend fit up higher.

column7: Tha shalt thou haue worshyp in the presence of them that syt at meate with the For whosoeuer exalteth hymselfe, shalbe brought lowe.
column8: Than shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that fit at meat with thee For whosoever exalteth himself, shall brought low.

column7: And he that humbleth hymselfe, shalbe exalted.
column8: And he that humbleth himself, shall exalted.

column7: AT the begynnynge of our gospell good christe people Iesu Christ doth comende vnto vs syngularly loue and charitie towarde al men, whan we se that so familiarly he hauted and frequented wyth them that were hys enemyes and hys euell wyllers, that also he dyd eate and drynke wyth them for to haue occasion to teache them and to conuerte them vnto God hys father as the auncient doctour Cyrillus noteth. <NOTE> And here be rebuked and checked those whych haue hatred, malyce, & rancor agaynst theyr christen brethren, and do not vouchsaufe to company wyth them, nor also to speake vnto them, whan yt by the diuine commaundement of almyghtye God they be bounde for to to remytte and to pardon al iniuries, <NOTE> and ought by all meanes they can for to recocile them, or els God shall neuer be reconciled wyth them.
column8: AT the beginning of our gospel good christe people Jesu Christ does commend unto us syngularly love and charity toward all men, when we see that so familiarly he hauted and frequented with them that were his enemies and his evil willers, that also he did eat and drink with them for to have occasion to teach them and to convert them unto God his father as the ancient doctor Cyrillus notes. And here be rebuked and checked those which have hatred, malice, & rancour against their christian brothers, and do not vouchsafe to company with them, nor also to speak unto them, when that by the divine commandment of almighty God they be bound for to to remytte and to pardon all injuries, and ought by all means they can for to recocile them, or else God shall never be reconciled with them.

column7: Consequently Iesu Christe doth instructe vs that we ought at al tymes to accomplysh and do the workes of mercy towardes our brethren and neyghbours.
column8: Consequently Jesu Christe does instruct us that we ought at all times to accomplish and do the works of mercy towards our brothers and neighbours.

column7: P A G Eclxi And specially that the sondaye be not in any wyse violated by the sayd workes of charitie.
column8: PAGEclxi PAGEclxi PAGEclxi PAGEclxi And specially that the sondaye be not in any wise violated by the said works of charity.

column7: The whych he shewed well, whan that vpon the sabboth day he dyd heale the poore ma of the dropsie.
column8: The which he showed well, when that upon the sabbath day he did heal the poor ma of the dropsy.

column7: Which as holy doctours do expoune is truely the fygure of all humane nature, <NOTE> whych was spiritually ful of the dropsye, and ful of waters of concupiscence: wherby it peryshed and drewe vnto eternall death.
column8: Which as holy doctors do expoune is truly the figure of all humane nature, which was spiritually full of the dropsy, and full of waters of concupiscence: whereby it perished and drew unto eternal death.

column7: Moreouer in thys gospell Christ doth aduertise vs of these couetouse and proude scribes and pharisees whych by theyr ambition at the feastes and banckettes dyd take the fyrst and moost honourable places.
column8: Moreover in this gospel Christ does advertise us of these covetous and proud scribes and pharisees which by their ambition at the feasts and banckettes did take the fyrst and most honourable places.

column7: For the whych cause Iesu Christ doth correcte them, and instructeth them, and vs also, wyllynge vs whan we shalbe called vnto mariages and feastes, that we do not syt in the hyghest places but in the lowest.
column8: For the which cause Jesu Christ does correct them, and instructeth them, and us also, willing us when we shall called unto marriages and feasts, that we do not fit in the highest places but in the lowest.

column7: The whych maye be vnto vs very well a moral doctrine as to the exterior worke, as the holy doctours of the church do full well declare it, & in especiall the great clerke Basilius declareth it on thys wyse.
column8: The which may be unto us very well a moral doctrine as to the exterior work, as the holy doctors of the church do full well declare it, & in especial the great clerk Basilius declareth it on this wise.

column7: To take the lowest place at feastes accordynge to the Lordes commaundement is conuenient, but agayne contenciously to runne into it, is a thynge reprouable as a disturbaunce of ordre and occasion of hurly burly.
column8: To take the lowest place at feasts according to the Lords commandment is convenient, but again contenciously to run into it, is a thing reprovable as a disturbance of ordre and occasion of hurly burly.

column7: And surely sayeth thys clerke yf contencion be moued who shuld syt lowest amonges you, ye shall diffre nothynge from those that stryue to syt hyghest, for al is one mater.
column8: And surely sayeth this clerk if contention be moved who should fit lowest among you, you shall diffre nothing from those that strive to fit highest, for all is one mater.

column7: Wherfore lyke as our lorde sayeth here, it is expedient for hym that maketh a feast to appoynt the order of syttynge.
column8: Wherefore like as our lord sayeth here, it is expedient for him that makes a feast to appoint the order of sitting.

column7: So shal one of vs in pacience susteyne eche other honestly, and doynge al thynges in order and not after the fansye of some we shall neyther seme to conterfayte humilitie by ouermuche gaynsaynge but rather by humilitie we shall obtayne pacience.
column8: So shall one of us in patience sustain eke other honestly, and doing all things in order and not after the fancy of some we shall neither seem to conterfayte humility by overmuch gaynsaynge but rather by humility we shall obtain patience.

column7: For surely it is a greater token of pryde, by ouermuch repugnauncie & refusing not to syt in such place as the feastmaker thynketh mete for vs, and contenciously to occupie the lowest rowme, than it is to syt in the hyghest place wha we be commaunded so to do.
column8: For surely it is a greater token of pride, by overmuch repugnancy & refusing not to fit in such place as the feastmaker thinketh meet for us, and contenciously to occupy the lowest room, than it is to fit in the highest place wha we be commanded so to do.

column7: Thys sayenge therfore of Christ morally is thus to be taken.
column8: This saying therefore of Christ morally is thus to be taken.

column7: Yet for all that spiritually, it maye be well vnderstanded as Bede & other expositours also do godly applie it of the mariage of the sonne of God wyth humayne nature: whych is the vnion and the mariage of hym and all faythfull soules. <NOTE> Of the which it is wrytten in an other place.
column8: Yet for all that spiritually, it may be well understanded as Bede & other expositors also do godly apply it of the marriage of the son of God with human nature: which is the union and the marriage of him and all faithful souls. Of the which it is written in and other place.

column7: That many be called but fewe elected.
column8: That many be called but few elected.

column7: The whych sentence of God ought to astonny vs, & we ought diligently to consider what they be which be chosen, in desyrynge to be of theyr company.
column8: The which sentence of God ought to astonny us, & we ought diligently to consider what they be which be chosen, in desiring to be of their company.

column7: Truly Iesu Christe hymselfe doth shewe vs, sayenge: That whosoeuer doth huble hymselfe in makynge hymselfe seruaunt vnto all and doynge the workes of charitie to hys brethre for the honoure of hym, he shalbe elected or chosen and exalted.
column8: Truly Jesu Christe himself does show us, saying: That whosoever does huble himself in making himself servant unto all and doing the works of charity to his brethren for the honour of him, he shall elected or chosen and exalted.

column7: And on the contrary who soeuer shall exalte hymselfe in wyllynge by pryde to haue maystershyp and lordshyp ouer al, and vncharitably neglectynge and despysynge hys euen christen and poore brethren he shalbe humbled put downe, and cast backe fro the mariage, for God resysteth proude men, and gyueth grace vnto the huble.
column8: And on the contrary who soever shall exalt himself in willing by pride to have maystershyp and lordship over all, and uncharitably neglecting and despising his even christian and poor brothers he shall humbled put down, and cast back from the marriage, for God resisteth proud men, and gyveth grace unto the huble.

column7: Wherfore my fredes let vs at al tymes do good workes, and mercy vnto all.
column8: Wherefore my fredes let us at all times do good works, and mercy unto all.

column7: Let vs not be ambitious of worldly honoure.
column8: Let us not be ambitious of worldly honour.

column7: Let vs humble our selues P A G Eclxij vnder the myghty hande of God, & after thys lyfe we shalbe by hym exalted whan it shalbe hys pleasure and godly wyll into eternal glorye wyth the copany of all those that be happy for to prayse hym & blesse hym wythout ende.
column8: Let us humble our selves PAGEclxij PAGEclxij PAGEclxij PAGEclxij under the mighty hand of God, & after this life we shall by him exalted when it shall his pleasure and godly will into eternal glory with the copany of all those that be happy for to praise him & bless him without end.

column7: : homily The Epistle on the.xviij. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: : homily The Epistle on the xviij sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.i. Epistle to the Corin. the.i. Chap. Thargument A gratulacion or thankesgyuynge for ye true knowlege of godlynes.
column8: The i Epistle to the Corin. the i Chap. Thargument A gratulation or thankesgyuynge for you true knowledge of godliness.

column7: B Rethren, I thake my God alwayes on your behalfe: for the grace of god, which is gyue you by Iesus Christ, that in al thynges ye are made rych by hym, in al vtteraunce, and in al knowlege, by the whych thynges the testimony of Iesus Christ was cofermed in you, so that ye are behynde in no gyft waytynge for the appearynge of our Lorde Iesus Christ, whych shall also strength you vnto the ende that ye maye be blamelesse in the daye of the commynge of our Lorde Iesus Christ.
column8: BRethren BRethren, I thake my God always on your behalf: for the grace of god, which is gyve you by Jesus Christ, that in all things you are made rich by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge, by the which things the testimony of Jesus Christ was cofermed in you, so that you are behind in no gift waiting for the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ, which shall also strength you unto the end that you may be blameless in the day of the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

column7: S Aynt Paul good christen people in the epistle of thys present sondaye doth teache vs, yt he whych hath ye grace of God in hys harte, whan he seeth the poore synners leaue theyr euell lyfe, and that they conuerte them vnto God in grace, is excedyngly ioyfull, and continually yeldeth graces and thankes vnto God.
column8: SAynt SAynt Paul good christian people in the epistle of this present sondaye does teach us, that he which hath the grace of God in his heart, when he sees the poor sinners leave their evil life, and that they convert them unto God in grace, is exceedingly joyful, and continually yieldeth graces and thanks unto God.

column7: For it is wrytten in the.xiij. chapter of hys fyrst epistle vnto the Corinthias.
column8: For it is written in the xiij chapter of his fyrst epistle unto the Corinthias.

column7: Charitie doth not reioyce at iniquitie, that is to saye, of the estate of sinners but is in heuynesse, pytie, and compassion But it reioyceth of truth, whych is whan they leaue theyr synnes and the vanitie of thys worlde, & that they conuerte them vnto God whych is all veritie.
column8: Charity does not rejoice at iniquity, that is to say, of the estate of sinners but is in heaviness, pity, and compassion But it rejoices of truth, which is when they leave their sins and the vanity of this world, & that they convert them unto God which is all verity.

column7: And also ioye is made in heauen amonges the angels of God, as it is wrytte in the.xv. chapter of S. Luke.
column8: And also joy is made in heaven among the angels of God, as it is writ in the xv chapter of S. Lycia.

column7: It is ioye before the angels of God for a synner that doth penaunce.
column8: It is joy before the angels of God for a sinner that does penance.

column7: Also saynt Paule here yeldeth graces and thankes vnto God for the Corinthians: knowynge yt it was not by any workes that they had done, that they were conuerted, but by the only mercy of God not deserued on theyr behalfe.
column8: Also saint Paule here yieldeth graces and thanks unto God for the Corinthians: knowing that it was not by any works that they had done, that they were converted, but by the only mercy of God not deserved on their behalf.

column7: And thus it is of vs. In oure conuertynge by true fayth vnto Iesu Christ we be made ryche in hym in all thynges, in all wordes, and in al sciences, that is to saye, in the doctrine of the gospell, by the whyche is confermed vnto vs, the wytnes of our saluacion: knowyng certaynly, that the myght of god is in the Gospell for to saue all them whych shal beleue in it.
column8: And thus it is of us In our converting by true faith unto Jesu Christ we be made rich in him in all things, in all words, and in all sciences, that is to say, in the doctrine of the gospel, by the which is confirmed unto us, the witness of our salvation: knowing certainly, that the might of god is in the Gospel for to save all them which shall believe in it.

column7: But before that we be worthy to haue suche, and so great rychesses, we muste renounce and vtterly forsake the vayne confidence and trust in the rychesses and delytes of thys worlde.
column8: But before that we be worthy to have such, and so great richesses, we must renounce and utterly forsake the vain confidence and trust in the richesses and delights of this world.

column7: For Iesu Christ hymselfe sayeth vnto vs, <NOTE> that we can not serue God, and also the rychesses of thys worlde.
column8: For Jesu Christ himself sayeth unto us, that we can not serve God, and also the richesses of this world.

column7: Moreouer in an other place he sayeth, that yf we do not renounce in our mynde and affection all the goodes that we do possesse we can not be hys disciples.
column8: Moreover in and other place he sayeth, that if we do not renounce in our mind and affection all the goods that we do possess we can not be his disciples.

column7: Let vs tha hold vs by fayth in oure conuersion to God: the whyche fayth, foloweth so many gyftes and graces of God that there lacketh nothynge for saluation.
column8: Let us than hold us by faith in our conversion to God: the which faith, followeth so many gifts and graces of God that there lacketh nothing for salvation.

column7: And we shall abyde in all suertie and in peace of conscience, the commynge of Iesu Christ, whych shalbe particulerly at the daye of our death and departynge fro P A G Eclxiij thys worlde, and generally at ye daye of dome, at the whyche tyme he shall come and gyue vnto vs hys great & inestimable rychesses, the which we do nowe tarye for by fayth and hope, that is the eternal glorye of hys heauen.
column8: And we shall abide in all surety and in peace of conscience, the coming of Jesu Christ, which shall particularly at the day of our death and departing from PAGEclxiij PAGEclxiij PAGEclxiij PAGEclxiij this world, and generally at you day of dome, at the which time he shall come and gyve unto us his great & inestimable richesses, the which we do now tarry for by faith and hope, that is the eternal glory of his heaven.

column7: Into the whych that we maye all come by the graces and merytes of our Lorde Iesu Christ.
column8: Into the which that we may all come by the graces and merits of our Lord Jesu Christ.

column7: &c.: homily The gospell on the.xviij. sonday after Trinitie.
column8: etc.: homily The gospel on the xviij sonday after Trinitie.

column7: The.xxij. Chapter of Matheu.
column8: The xxij Chapter of Matheu.

column7: Thargument.
column8: Thargument.

column7: The pharisees question to Christ, and again Christes question to the pharisees.
column8: The pharisees question to Christ, and again Christes question to the pharisees.

column7: T He pharisees wet vnto Iesus, and one of them whyche was a doctour of the lawe of Moses, asked hym a question, temptynge hym, and sayeng Mayster whych is the great commaudement in the lawe?
column8: THe THe pharisees wet unto Jesus, and one of them which was a doctor of the law of Moses, asked him a question, tempting him, and saying Master which is the great commaudement in the law?

column7: Iesus sayd vnto hym: Thou shalt loue the Lorde thy God wyth all thy harte, and wyth al thy mynde.
column8: Jesus said unto him: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy mind.

column7: Thys is the fyrst and great comaundement And the seconde is lyke vnto it.
column8: This is the fyrst and great commandment And the seconde is like unto it.

column7: Thou shalte loue thyne neyghbour as thy selfe.
column8: Thou shalt love thine neighbour as thy self.

column7: In these two comaudementes hange all the lawe and the prophetes.
